name: Iframe
description: Component for iframe embedded external content with flexible sizing, background options, and spacing controls for safely embedding third-party content.

examples.name: Responsive Iframe
examples.description: Iframe without fixed dimensions for responsive behavior

when_to_use: Embed maps from external services (Google Maps, OpenStreetMap)
Include social media feeds or widgets
Embed video content from external platforms
Show content from other domains that must be sandboxed
when_not_to_use: For internal content that could be included directly
When the external content is not trusted or secure
For content that needs to be indexed by search engines
When responsive design is critical and iframe content doesn't adapt well
best_practices: Always specify appropriate security attributes (sandbox, allow policies)
Use HTTPS URLs for iframe sources when possible
Consider accessibility implications of embedded content
Test embedded content across different screen sizes
Provide fallback content or error handling for failed iframe loads
Be mindful of performance impact of embedded content
Use with_background option to visually integrate iframes with site design

accessibility.notes: Accessibility depends heavily on the embedded content. Ensure iframe content is accessible and provide appropriate titles/descriptions.

known_issues: Some external content may not work well in responsive designs
Cross-origin security restrictions may affect functionality
Performance can be impacted by external content loading times
variations: Basic iframe: Simple embedding with URL and dimensions
Background wrapper: Adds themed background around iframe content
Responsive iframe: Uses CSS to adapt to container dimensions
Spacing variations: Control vertical spacing around iframe
